Package TableStructures

Class AssociatedTableType

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractObjects.DataType
      • TableStructures.TableType
        • TableStructures.AssociatedTableType

  • public class AssociatedTableType
extends TableType
    This is best explained by an example. Consider a table type with columns "student, semester, mark", for example to be used for exam results.
    If we want to collect each student's exam results, we could use another table with columns "exam, semester, mark" to be used as attribute value for an attribute "exam-results". This is a table type which is derived from the original table by replacing a particular column with a new column.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • AssociatedTableType

        public AssociatedTableType​(java.lang.String applicationName,
                           TableType originalTableType,
                           java.lang.String oldColumnName,
                           java.lang.String newColumnName,
                           DataType newColumnType,
                           Context context)
        generates for a table type an associated table type.
        Parameters:
        applicationName - the name of the table type (e.g. "exam-results")
        originalTableType - the original table type
        oldColumnName - the column name of the original table to be replaced by the new column
        newColumnName - the new column name.
        newColumnType - the new column type
        context - the context.
